entry.title: New release for Dockpeek: Dockpeek v1.1
entry.content:
What's New in v1.1

Multi-Docker Socket Support

You can now connect to and manage containers across multiple Docker hosts simultaneously.

Refresh Button

Added a refresh button that not only reloads the container list, but also updates the list of available Docker hosts.

‚öôÔ∏è New Environment Variables

Support for multiple Docker hosts via environment variables: - DOCKER_HOST_N_URL - DOCKER_HOST_N_NAME - DOCKER_HOST_N_PUBLIC_HOSTNAME

The README.md has been rewritten and clarified with better descriptions and examples.

entry.title: New release for Dockpeek: v1.2.1
entry.content:
UI Improvements

  • Refined user interface for better clarity and usability
  • Minor layout and style adjustments for a smoother experience

Bug Fixes & Stability

  • Improved handling of inactive and missing servers
  • Enhanced fallback logic for single-server mode

This release focuses on polishing the user experience and ensuring more reliable behavior when server availability changes.

entry.title: New release for Dockpeek: v1.3.2
entry.content:
Features

  • DOCKER_HOST_NAME support for custom display names: Add DOCKER_HOST_NAME environment variable to override default name
  • Container port search functionality: Restored and container search capabilities
  • Server sorting by environment-defined order and status: Servers are now sorted by their configuration order and connection status

Usage Examples

yaml DOCKER_HOST=tcp://dockpeek-socket-proxy:2375 DOCKER_HOST_NAME=my-custom-name DOCKER_HOST_PUBLIC_HOSTNAME=192.168.1.100

feat: prioritize public hostname and improve link generation logic

  • Unix sockets now always use current request host instead of localhost
  • TCP connections extract IP directly from URL when public hostname not set
